attributes.action: Don't abolish the Department for International Development.
attributes.additional_details:
This move would:

- Deprive DfID of a voice in cabinet
- Remove autonomy from DfID
- Reshape UK aid spending priorities, resulting in the politicisation of foreign aid spending
- Open the door for cuts in foreign aid spending

At a time when COVID-19 threatens to push global extreme poverty up to over 1billion, Boris Johnson’s government’s move to de-prioritise aid spending fails billions of people around the world.
attributes.background: The UK government has announced it's intention to abolish the Department for International Development, merging it's activities into the Foreign Office. This should not happen.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327602
